deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
@title  PolicyCore
 @notice Core logic of Naughty Price Product
         Preset:
              (Done in the naughtyFactory contract)
              1. Deploy policyToken contract
              2. Deploy policyToken-Stablecoin pool contract
         User Interaction:
              1. Deposit Stablecoin and mint PolicyTokens
              2. Redeem their Stablecoin and burn the PolicyTokens (before settlement)
              3. Claim for payout with PolicyTokens (after settlement)
         PolicyTokens are minted with the ratio 1:1 to Stablecoin
         The PolicyTokens are traded in the pool with CFMM (xy=k)
         When the event happens, a PolicyToken can be burned for claiming 1 Stablecoin.
         When the event does not happen, the PolicyToken depositors can
         redeem their 1 deposited Stablecoin
 @dev    Most of the functions to be called from outside will use the name of policyToken
         rather than the address(easy to read).
         Other variables or functions still use address to index.
         The rule of policyToken naming is Original Token Name + Strike Price + Lower or Higher + Date
         E.g.  AVAX30L202101, BTC30000L202102, ETH8000H202109

documentation.text:
@title  PolicyCore
 @notice Core logic of Naughty Price Product
         Preset:
              (Done in the naughtyFactory contract)
              1. Deploy policyToken contract
              2. Deploy policyToken-Stablecoin pool contract
         User Interaction:
              1. Deposit Stablecoin and mint PolicyTokens
              2. Redeem their Stablecoin and burn the PolicyTokens (before settlement)
              3. Claim for payout with PolicyTokens (after settlement)
         PolicyTokens are minted with the ratio 1:1 to Stablecoin
         The PolicyTokens are traded in the pool with CFMM (xy=k)
         When the event happens, a PolicyToken can be burned for claiming 1 Stablecoin.
         When the event does not happen, the PolicyToken depositors can
         redeem their 1 deposited Stablecoin
 @dev    Most of the functions to be called from outside will use the name of policyToken
         rather than the address(easy to read).
         Other variables or functions still use address to index.
         The rule of policyToken naming is Original Token Name + Strike Price + Lower or Higher + Date
         E.g.  AVAX30L202101, BTC30000L202102, ETH8000H202109

Other variables or functions still use address to index.         The rule of policyToken naming is Original Token Name + Strike Price + Lower or Higher + Date         E.g. claim(string,address,uint256).details: It is done after result settlement and only if the result is true

params._amount: Amount of USDT (also the amount of policy tokens)

params._degis: Address of degis token, used for purchase incentive

deployPolicyToken(string,address,bool,ui.details: Only the owner can deploy new policy token

params._deadline: Deadline of this policy token (deposit / redeem / swap)
params._isCall: The policy is for higher or lower than the strike price (call / put)
params._settleTimestamp: Can settle after this timestamp (for oracle)
params._tokenAddress: Address of the original token (e.g. AVAX, BTC, ETH...)

returns._0: policyTokenAddress The address of the policy token just deployed
poolAddress The address of the pool just deployed

params._amount: Amount of stablecoin (also the amount of policy tokens)

returns._0: policyTokenAddress Address of the policy token
Whether it is a supported stablecoin

redeem(string,address,uint256).details: Redeem happens before the deadline and is different from claim/settle

params._amount: Amount of USDT (also the amount of policy tokens)

setPurchaseIncentiveAmount(uint256).details: policyToken amount(not happened) / ratio = incentive amount (in DEG)

params._newRatio: The amount is calculated by this ratio

settleAllPolicyTokens(address,address,ui.details: Take care of the gas cost and can use the _startIndex and _stopIndex to control the size

devdoc.title: PolicyCore

claim(string,address,uint256).notice: Claim a payoff based on policy tokens

deployPolicyToken(string,address,bool,ui.notice: Deploy a new policy token and return the token address

deposit(string,address,uint256).notice: Deposit stablecoins and get policy tokens

findAddressbyName(string).notice: Find the token address by its name

getPolicyTokenInfo(string).notice: Find the token information by its name

isStablecoinAddress(address).notice: Check if this is a stablecoin address supported, used in naughtyFactory

redeem(string,address,uint256).notice: Burn policy tokens and redeem USDT

settleAllPolicyTokens(address,address,ui.notice: Settle the policies when then insurance event do not happen         Funds are automatically distributed back to the depositors

settleFinalResult(string).notice: Get the final price from the PriceGetter contract

userdoc.notice: Core logic of Naughty Price Product         Preset:              (Done in the naughtyFactory contract)              1. Deploy policyToken contract              2. Deploy policyToken-Stablecoin pool contract         User Interaction:              1. Deposit Stablecoin and mint PolicyTokens              2. Redeem their Stablecoin and burn the PolicyTokens (before settlement)              3. Claim for payout with PolicyTokens (after settlement)         PolicyTokens are minted with the ratio 1:1 to Stablecoin         The PolicyTokens are traded in the pool with CFMM (xy=k)         When the event happens, a PolicyToken can be burned for claiming 1 Stablecoin.         When the event does not happen, the PolicyToken depositors can         redeem their 1 deposited Stablecoin
